title: CNICS Modified ASSIST
description: The CNICS Modified ASSIST is based on the "NIDA-Modified ASSIST version 2.0"(LOINC 95513-8). It uses different terms and examples (e.g. psychedelics instead of hallucinogens), and asks aobut using multiple substances at the same time, and overdoses.

code.display: In your LIFETIME, which of the following substances have you ever used?

item.text: In your LIFETIME, which of the following substances have you ever used?

valueCoding.display: Prescription stimulants (Ritalin, Concerta, Dexedrine, Adderall, diet pills, etc.)
Inhalants (nitrous oxide, glue, gas, paint thinner, etc.)
Sedatives or sleeping pills (Valium, Serepax, Ativan, Xanax, Librium, Rohypnol, GHB, etc.)
Hallucinogens (LSD, acid, mushrooms, PCP, Special K, ecstasy, etc.)
Prescription opioids (fentanyl, oxycodone [OxyContin, Percocet], hydrocodone [Vicodin], methadone, buprenorphine, etc.)

A drug overdose happens when a drug (or combination of drugs) causes trouble breathing or passing out, requiring help from another person to prevent harm or death.
Have you ever overdosed (OD'd) on drugs? [such as heroin, fentanyl or pain pills; cocaine/crack/meth; anti-anxiety meds, etc.]
A drug overdose happens when a drug (or combination of drugs) causes trouble breathing or passing out, requiring help from another person to prevent harm or death.
In the last 6 months, how many times have you overdosed (OD'd) on drugs? [such as heroin, fentanyl or pain pills; cocaine/crack/meth; anti-anxiety meds, etc.]
Do you have a supply of or prescription for Narcan?
